item.title: Three Key Takeaways From Big Bank Earnings
item.description: Top U.S. banks, including Bank of America, JPMorgan and Goldman, posted better-than-expected quarterly results thanks to a resilient economy, strong consumer spending and a flurry of Wall Street activity.

item.title: Hollywood Still Banks On the Familiar for Box Office
item.description: Sequels from lesser-tapped franchises are expected to dominate this year’s film releases, but Wall Street anticipates weak overall results.

item.title: Tesla Is Running Out of Time to Deliver on Self-Driving Promises
item.description: The electric-vehicle pioneer seems to be shifting its growth hopes to the unproven technology of automated driving.

item.title: China's Overcapacity Is Already Backfiring
item.description: Excess investment in industry isn’t made up by China’s trading partners, and it has domestic consequences.

item.title: Fire Ravages Copenhagen's Historic Stock Exchange
item.description: A fire ripped through Copenhagen’s old stock exchange, collapsing the building’s iconic spire, a centerpiece of the city’s skyline since the 17th century.

item.title: PwC Pushes Back at Evergrande Letter
item.description: PricewaterhouseCoopers has responded to a public letter that blamed some of its executives for the global accounting firm’s exposure to China Evergrande, the fallen property giant.

item.title: Trump's Truth Social Stake Shrinks by $3 Billion After Stock Tanks
item.description: Shares are down about 60% from a recent peak after the first three weeks of trading.

item.title: Fitch Ratings Downgrades Outlook for Chinese State-Owned Banks
item.description: Fitch Ratings has downgraded the outlook for six Chinese state-owned banks amid concerns about the government’s ability to support the sector in the event of stress.

item.title: Chinese Developer Sinks After HSBC Subsidiary Files Liquidation Petition
item.description: A subsidiary of HSBC wants to liquidate debt-troubled Times China, in another instance of creditors seeking to recoup funds from developers amid China’s protracted property slump.

item.title: Market Reaction to Iran Attack Tells Us Stocks Aren't in a Bubble
item.description: The swings on Friday and Monday put to bed for now concerns that a bubble has been forming.

item.title: Wall Street Is Betting OPEC+ Can Fend Off $100 Oil
item.description: Traders expect spare capacity will cap crude prices despite the conflict in the Middle East.

item.title: Tax Day Outage at H&R Block Frustrates Last-Minute Filers
item.description: The company said it has fixed an issue that had affected desktop software users.

item.title: Here's What Higher for Longer Means for the Stock Market
item.description: Stocks are still trading near record levels, but some investors say further gains may be more difficult to come by.

item.title: Stocks Extend Slump, Treasury Yields Climb
item.description: Hot monthly retail sales and Middle East tensions weigh on indexes, with the S&P 500 falling 1.2%.

item.title: Wall Street Powers Goldman to Higher Quarterly Earnings
item.description: Revenue from investment banking and trading, the bank’s traditional powerhouses, surged.

item.title: Base Metal Prices Rise After Russian Ban
item.description: Aluminum and nickel prices rose in London after the U.S. and U.K. banned fresh trading in metals originating from Russia.

item.title: CertainBiotech Investors Get an Early Look at Results. Is That Fair?
item.description: Private investments in public equities, or PIPEs, are all the rage in biotech, but some investors resent the sharing of nonpublic information.

item.title: CVC Looks to Raise at Least $1.3 Billion in Amsterdam IPO
item.description: The global buyout firm is making a second attempt to go public in less than six months.

item.title: Your Tax Refund Is Delayed. It Could Be Years.
item.description: Taxpayers usually get their federal tax-refund check within 21 days of filing a return. Some unlucky ones wait a lot longer.

item.title: How to Lower Your Tax Bill With the Charitable-Donation Deduction
item.description: Getting a tax break for contributions to charity often requires careful planning.
